content.description: Climb up the mini tufas to the first bolt and then move right to pull the roof.  Last bolt moves back to the left.  Shares anchors with Antiqua (to the left of Underdog).  Felt hard for the grade until I figured out the beta.  Now it seems accurate for 5.11b.
content.protection: 3 bolts - shares anchors with Antiqua to the left
content.location: Start is in the middle of a grey streak.  First route left of Jimmy's Rig.

content.description: Pull off of the ground on some interesting fractured cool looking rock to the left of the first bolt. Head up onto the slabby section and the second clip. Some horizontals take you to the 3rd bolt and a thin section going up to the anchors. Jugs to the right and left of the anchor.
content.location: The second route from the left in the area. There is a large block that forms a right facing corner at the left edge of the wall. also climbs the right edge of a big white patch. Or a "Tit" on the underside of a head height roof.

content.description: Same start as Jimmy's rig but once you get your feet on the headwall and past the first crux traverse right to a big cave and then up. Interesting finish with some hidden holds. Harder ending than Jimmy's Rig.
content.location: Far right end of Tit for Tom wall. Last pair of chains before the Curious George roof.

content.description: Bolt 1 is above a boulder stack where the belayer can stand.
content.location: Just right of the arete on the right side of Curious George's roof

content.description: The crux of this textbook "two-move wonder" comes straight off the start hold.  Make a reachy move up to a crimp with the left hand, get your feet up, and make one more long crank with the right to a sharp "pair of scissors" hold.  This move is a likely blood-letter if you go out of control.  If you stick it, enjoy 5.8 climbing to the top!
content.location: This climb is four bolt lines to the right of Tit for Tom at the Tit for Tom wall.

content.description: This is a really short route, with only two bolts. But the first one is about as high as most second bolts, so you might want to stick it. You will probably find the holds to be rough on your hands.
A fun tufa pull to start and then continue up on decent holds. Bolt 1 is sticking out from the rock so stickclip bolt 2.
content.location: Starts on a prominent tufa formation. There is a 5-10 foot long boulder right behind the route.

content.description:
Surprisingly fun route that doesn't see a lot of action. The bottom section is a bit chossy and breaking holds could make things more difficult. 

  Shares a starting first bolt and crux with Ralph's Rig. Stick clip the first bolt and navigate the crux boulder problem. Once established above the first bolt, trend up and slightly left through easier climbing.
content.protection: 3 bolts. Anchors + chains, no quick links.
content.location: 2nd to last pair of anchors going right to left on the Tit for Tom wall (besides Curious George). The anchors for Ralph's rig are about 20 feet to the right.

content.description:
Scramble up onto deeply incut sidepulls and underclings.  Fire a few crux moves up on some non-ideal handholds (the usual sharp granulated crimper?-sloper?-dross you find at Reimers) to a big ledge for the second clip.  After the clip, hit the high nubbin-crimp on the left and then step up to the right-handed jug for the third clip and the finish. 

  Really nice motion all the way up... feels like a gym route!
content.location: Two routes right of Tit for Tom at the Tit for Tom wall.

content.description: The route traverses left under the large roof before pulling over the lip on large huecos to a short headwall just below the chains. The climbing itself has a variety of movement and will force a thin sequence along with a good pump. One of the longest routes at the ranch.
content.protection: 8 Bolts + Sport Chains: Bolt 1 is low and often missed because it is not obvious.
content.location: Curious George is the route on the large wide roof that lies between T-Roofic and the Tit for Tom walls. The start of the route is on top of a 10ft shelf, next to a large leaning boulder. Look low on the shelf for your first bolt.

content.description: Enjoy fun and powerful moves over a roof. If you're tall, you may be able to skip a gaston or sidepull.
content.location: Left side of a roof section of the wall.

content.description: Climb a blank face to a pumpy finish. The route may be least difficult with dynamic movements, including a left-handed dyno.
content.protection: 3 bolts and anchors. May want a long sling for first bolt to reduce drag.
content.location: Start off a block, left of the first bolt.

content.description: Height dependent grade. Start left of the tufas. Climb up under the roof, short boulder problem, cut some feet, may feel a little lost if you don't know the beta but its all there, and pretty dang fun. Shares anchors with Underdog.
content.location: Tufas under the roof, to the left of underdog.

content.description: This short wall is way around to the right past Dead Cats. The wall probably averages about 20 feet tall with routes of 3 bolts in length. Most of the anchors are chains w/o biners so you have to thread the anchors to clean. Chances are you will not see anyone down this far and the wall does not receive much traffic. Most of the routes are 5.11 with about 10 routes total.
